references.reason: This book provides a foundational treatment of online learning theory, which is central to the paper's theoretical analysis.

references.paper_title: The statistical complexity of interactive decision making
references.reason: This paper introduces the DMSO framework for interactive decision-making, which motivates and contextualizes the current research.

references.paper_title: Separating distribution-free and mistake-bound learning models over the boolean domain
references.reason: This paper establishes foundational computational complexity results for online learning, which are relevant to the computational complexity analysis in the current work.
This work provides a comprehensive overview of statistical learning theory and sequential prediction, forming the basis for many of the techniques used in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Information-theoretic determination of minimax rates of convergence
references.reason: This paper provides fundamental results on minimax rates of convergence in statistical estimation, which are used to establish lower bounds for the online estimation problem.
